properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the Sydney Shimmer Festival on Forbes and Bourke Streets in Darlinghurst. The event will run on Friday 5pm to 11pm, Saturday 10am to 11pm and Sunday 10am to 5pm.

The following roads will be closed from 4am Friday 14 October to 10am Monday 17 October:

  • Forbes St between Burton St and Bourke St
  • Bourke St between Forbes St and Burton St

Special event clearways will also be in effect on both sides of these roads from 4am Friday 14 October to 1am Monday 17 October. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully for the most up-to-date information as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.
Speed reductions will be in place for north and southbound motorists. Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on the Barton Highway at Field Days entrance.
properties.diversions: Event traffic detour via Euroka Ave, Patemans Lane and Murrumbateman Road will be in place.

properties.otherAdvice:
Banna Avenue will be closed between Crossing Street and Jondaryan Avenue at the following times:

  • Set up - Sun 9 Oct 6am-2:30pm
  • Event launch - Fri 14 Oct 4:30pm-10:30pm
  • Pack up - Sun 22 Oct 6am-2:30pm

Detour for all vehicles via Bridge St/Crossing St during these times.

A speed zone reduction and heavy vehicle detour will be in place at all other times during the exhibition.
properties.diversions: Heavy vehicle detour via Bridge St and Crossing St during exhibition.

properties.otherAdvice:
Delays are expected on major roads approaching Bathurst including the M4 Mwy, Great Western Hwy and Bells Line of Rd from Sydney, Mitchell Hwy from Orange, Mid Western Hwy from Cowra and Castlereagh Hwy from Mudgee.

Traffic controllers will be on-site on local roads to manage access to and from the Mount Panorama precinct.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time over the weekend and expect delays on Monday 10 October as fans head home from Bathurst.

_____________________________

VICTORIA PASS - Monday 10 October

Traffic is expected to be heavy along the Great Western Highway from Bathurst towards Sydney, with significant eastbound delays expected at Blackheath in the Blue Mountains. Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Great Western Highway at Mount Victoria, with queing expected.

In the event of eastbound traffic queues extending from Blackheath to Mount Victoria, traffic management will be in place at the bottom of Victoria Pass on Great Western Highway, Little Hartley. Traffic will be held at this location to avoid breakdowns resulting from queuing on Victoria Pass, and to ensure the safe passage of motorists up the Pass. 

_______________________________

COWRA - Monday 10 October

Reduced speed zones will be in place on the Mid Western Hwy in Cowra with delays and queuing expected.

properties.otherAdvice:
More than 6,000 cyclists will take to the streets from St Leonards Park in North Sydney to Tumbalong Park in Darling Harbour for the 10km ride or to Cathy Freeman Park in Sydney Olympic Park for the 50km ride in the annual Spring Cycle event. From Darling Harbour to Olympic Park riders will share roads with motorists and abide by regular road rules. Drivers are reminded to leave a 1.5m distance when overtaking cyclists on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under. Road closures will be in place along the first 10km of the course including:

North Sydney

  • 4am to 10.30am: Miller St between Falcon St and Ridge St and Berry St from Pacific Hwy to Walker St.
  • 4am to 11am: Miller St between Ridge St and the Pacific Hwy, Little Walker St and Arthur St
  • Local roads off Berry St will be closed from 6am to 9.30am. A section of Blue St at North Sydney Station will close from 4am to 9.30am.

Cahill Expressway & Sydney Harbour Bridge

  • 4am to 10:30am: Lanes 7 and 8 on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Mount St and High St on ramps. Lanes 3 and 6 will be closed on the Sydney Harbour Bridge deck – two lanes will remain open in both directions. A 40km/h speed limit will be in effect while riders share lanes on the bridge. 
  • 4am to 11am: Cahill Expressway Circular Quay Overpass in both directions

Sydney CBD, Millers Point, Barangaroo

  • 4am to 10.30am: sections of Upper Fort St and Watson Rd
  • 4am to 11am: Hickson Rd southbound from Towns Place to Napoleon St, sections of Towns Place, Dalgety Rd, Napoleon St, Sussex St and King St

Western Distributor from Pyrmont to the City

  • 4am to 11.15am – closed from Pyrmont on-ramp to City North off ramp at King St. Motorists travelling citybound from the Anzac Bridge will be diverted via the Bathurst St off-ramp where they can re-join the Harbour Bridge via Harbour St or Kent St.

Darling Harbour and Pyrmont

  • 4am to 11.15am: sections of Pyrmont St, Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Murray St, Union St, Bunn St and other local roads.
  • 4am to 11.30am: Darling Drive closed southbound from Pyrmont Bridge Rd to Pier St

Local roads in Olympic Park will also be closed between 7.30am and 3pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of the course in North Sydney, Millers Point and Pyrmont between 3am and 11am, and in Five Dock between 5am and 11am. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
Sydney Harbour Bridge And Cahill Expressway

From 4:00am to 11:00am

  • Sydney Harbour Bridge deck, lane 3 northbound and lane 6 southbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge Grosvenor Street on ramp Northbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge Clarence Street on ramp Northbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge Cahill Expressway Lanes 7 and 8 Southbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge Cahill Expressway High Street on ramp Southbound
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge Cahill Expressway Mount Street on ramp Southbound
  • Cahill Expressway at The Domain Tunnel on ramp Northbound
  • Cahill Expressway Circular Quay overpass
  • Sydney Harbour Bridge Cahill Expressway approach from Warringah Freeway Northbound

Western Distributor

From 4:00am to 11:15am

  • Western Distributor Fig Street and Harris Street on ramp Eastbound
  • Western Distributor Pyrmont Street on ramp Southbound
  • Western Distributor Sydney Harbour Bridge on ramp from Anzac Bridge Eastbound
  • Western Distributor King Street off ramp from Anzac Bridge Northbound

Note: citybound traffic from Anzac Bridge will be diverted via Bathurst Street off ramp


North Sydney

From 4:00am to 9:30am

  • Blue St between Pacific Hwy and Miller St Westbound
  • Miller St lane 1 between Blue St and Pacific Hwy Northbound

From 4:00am to 10:30am

  • Berry St 1 between Pacific Hwy and Walker St
  • Miller St ² between Ridge St and Pacific Hwy

1 Vehicle crossover on Walker St at Berry St open at all times

2 Vehicle crossover on Miller St at Ridge St open at all times

 

From 4:00am to 11:00am

  • Arthur St between Berry St and Mount St
  • Berry St between Walker St and Arthur St
  • Carlow St between West St and Miller St
  • Little Walker St between Berry St and Mount St
  • Miller St between Falcon St and Ridge St
  • Mount Street between Arthur Street and Cahill Expressway Eastbound Lane 2

From 6:00am to 9:30am

  • Angelo St between McLaren St and Berry St
  • Bullivant Ln from Berry St
  • Denison St 1 between Spring St and Berry St
  • Little Spring St between Berry St and Spring St
  • Ward St from Berry St

1 Local access available from Spring St to Denison St. No access to Berry St from Denison St.


The Rocks / Millers Point / Sydney CBD

From 4:00am to 10:30am

  • Argyle Street between Lower Fort Street and Kent Street Westbound
  • Grosvenor St between Lang St and York St Westbound
  • Upper Fort Street between Watson Road and Sydney Observatory
  • Watson Road between Upper Fort Street and Argyle Street  

From 4:00am To 11:00am

  • Argyle Place 1 between Kent Street and Dalgety Rd Westbound
  • Bettington Street 2 between Dalgety Road and Merriman Street
  • Conservatorium Road from Macquarie Street
  • Dalgety Road between Windmill Street and Towns Place Northbound
  • Hickson Road 3 between Towns Place and Napoleon Street Southbound
  • King Street between Sussex Street and Kent Street Eastbound
  • Merriman Street 2 from Bettington Street
  • Napoleon Street 4 between Kent Street and Sussex Street Westbound
  • Rodens Lane 2 from Bettington Street
  • Sussex Street between Napoleon Street and Erskine Street Southbound
  • Sussex Street 5 between Erskine Street and King Street Southbound
  • Towns Place between Dalgety Road and Hickson Road Eastbound

1 No access to Argyle Place from High Street

2 Managed exit to Dalgety Road southbound only

3 Managed local access via Hickson Road southbound at Towns Place only. No right turn from Watermans Quay onto Hickson Road

4 Managed local access for Napoleon Street residents. No access to Hickson Road

5 Managed access to Slip Street from Erskine Street. Managed access to Hyatt Regency Sydney hotel.


Darling Harbour / Pyrmont

From 4:00am to 11:15am

  • Bunn Lane 1 between Pyrmont Street and Experiment Street Westbound
  • Bunn Street 2 between Pyrmont Street and Murray Street
  • Edward Lane 2 between Pyrmont Street and Harwood Lane
  • Edward Street between Pyrmont Bridge Road and Union Street
  • Gipps Street between Pyrmont Street and Experiment Street
  • Harwood Lane 2 between Union Lane and Bunn Street
  • Harwood Street 2 between Pyrmont Bridge Road and Bunn Street
  • Little Edward Street 2 between Pyrmont Bridge Road and Edward Lane
  • Pyrmont Bridge Road between Harris Street and Pyrmont Street Eastbound
  • Pyrmont Bridge Road between Pyrmont Street and Union Street
  • Pyrmont Street between Pyrmont Bridge Road and Allen Street
  • Union Lane 2 between Harwood Street and Murray Street
  • Union Street between Edward Street and Murray Street

1 Exit remains available to Experiment Street

2 Managed local access via Murray Street. Approach via Darling Drive and left into Murray Street. Exit  via Murray Street southbound and left onto Pyrmont Street. Note: a height restriction of 3.8m of the Western Distributor on-ramp at Murray Street and Pyrmont Street


From 4:00am to 11:30am

  • Darling Drive 3 between Murray Street and Pier St roundabout Southbound
  • Pier St off-ramp from Pier St Westbound

3 ICC P1 and P2 carparks open. Vehicles may exit onto Darling Drive southbound


Ultimo

From 6:00am to 10:00am

  • Kelly Street between Mountain Street and Bay Street Eastbound
  • Mountain Lane between West End Lane and Kelly Street

Sydney Olympic Park

From 7:30am to 1:30pm

  • Hill Road between Old Hill Road and Pondage Link Road Northbound
  • Edwin Flack Avenue from Pondage Link Road Southbound

From 7:30am to 3:00pm

  • Olympic Blvd between Kevin Combes Ave and Dawn Fraser Ave


Cycleway Closures

Pyrmont

From 4:00am to 11:15am

  • Union Street between Edward Street and Murray Street Eastbound

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.otherAdvice:
School of Rock Musical at Qudos Bank Arena on Tuesday and Wednesday, start from 7pm both nights.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Sydney Kings v Cairns at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip off from 7:15pm, finish around 9:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Newcastle Jets v Perth Glory at McDonald Jones Stadium. Start 5pm, finish approx 6.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A-League: Macarthur FC v Adelaide United at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Start from 3pm, finish approx 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Everest Day - The Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 12.30pm, last race 6.10pm, followed by a concert from 6.30pm.

With up to 30,000 attendees expected, traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

A dedicated drop off zone will be located on Darley Rd or a dedicated taxi rank is located at the racecourse entry on Ascot St.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.


RANDWICK

  • 4am – midnight: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side

properties.otherAdvice:
Bruno Mars concerts at Allianz Stadium. Gates open 5.30pm each night, acts start nights from 7.30pm, finish around 10.30pm.

With a crowd of up to 40,000 expected each night, traffic will be heavy particularly during the already busy evening peak on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the match and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park from Moore Park Rd, or from the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit. Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Chalmers Street between Cleveland Street and Devonshire Street (western side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

Red Hot Summer Tour at Bella Vista Farm from 1.10pm until approx. 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the event site particularly at the start and the end of the event, including on Norwest Blvd, Elizabeth MacArthur Dr and Westwood Way.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual italian festival held along Norton Street from 10am to 5pm. 

Traffic will be heavy in the area and on approach to Leichhardt including Parramatta Rd, City West Link Rd and Great Western Hwy. Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and expect delays.

Roads will be closed from 3am to 9pm Norton St will be closed between Marion St and William St, and surrounding local roads including sections of Arthur St, Allen St, Short St and Wetherill St.

From 6am to 9pm sections of Allen Street, Carlisle St, Derbyshire Rd, Lou St, Macauley St, Marlborough Street will also be closed. Local access will be maintained through Macauley St and Wetherill St.

Special event clearways will be in effect along both sides of Norton St between Marion St and William St from 3am to 9pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

From 3am to 9pm:

  • Norton Street between Marion Street and William Street
  • Allen Street between Derbyshire Road and Norton Street
  • Arthur Street between Allen Street and Short Street
  • Short Street between Norton Street and Balmain Road
  • Wetherill Street* between Norton Street and Balmain Road

* Vehicle access will be maintained to Wetherill St for local residents entry and exit via Derbyshire Rd.

 

From 6am to 9pm:

  • Allen Street between Norton Street and James Street
  • Carlisle Street between Norton Street and Cromwell Street
  • Derbyshire Road at William Street
  • Macauley Street* between Norton Street and Cromwell Street
  • Marlborough Street between Norton Street and Cromwell Street
  • Lou Street, parallel to Norton Street between Marion Street and Allen Street
  • Un-named lane off Short Street
  • * Vehicle access will be maintained to Macauley St for local residents entry and exit via Cromwell St


SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call the Traffic Information Line on 132 701 to find its new location.

LEICHHARDT - FROM 3AM TO 9PM

  • Norton St between Marion St and William St (both sides)

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Stanley Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Road closures will be in place between 9am and 11:30pm on sections of Stanley St, Riley St and Yurong St.

Motorists will be detoured via Crown Street, William Street, College Street and Francis Street.

﻿Special event clearways will also be in effect on sections of these streets from 8am until 11:30pm

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

Darlinghurst

From 9am to 11:30pm

  • Riley Street between Stanley Street and Stanley Lane
  • Riley Street between Stanley Street and Francis Lane
  • Stanley Street between Yurong Street and Crown Street
  • Yurong Street * between William Street and Stanley Lane (Southbound)
  • Yurong Street between Stanley Lane and Stanley Street
  • * Resident only access from William Street to Yurong Street

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

﻿Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

Darlinghurst

From 8am to 11:30pm

  • Stanley Street between Crown Street and Yurong Street (both sides)
  • Riley Street between Francis Lane and Stanley Street (Western side)
  • Riley Street between Chapel Street and Stanley Street (Eastern side)
  • Riley Street between Stanley Lane and Stanley Street (both sides)

properties.otherAdvice:
Motorists are advised to expect delays on Griffiths Road at the entrance to the Newcastle

Entertainment Centre and Showgrounds (NECS) between 7pm and 10pm on Wednesday 12 October, 2022.

Right hand turns from Griffiths Road into the NECS may be restricted, causing delays for some motorists.

Left hand turns into the NECS will not be impacted.

Motorists are asked to be patient, follow signs and instructions from Police and traffic controllers.
properties.displayName: Horizons - A 21st Century Space Odessey - Newcastle Entertainment Centre

properties.otherAdvice: Vincent Street will be closed from Wollombi Rd to Hall St; Cooper St will be closed from Cumberland St to Charlton St and Charlton St will be closed from the North Charlton car park to 50m south of Cooper St.
properties.diversions:
Light Vehicle Detours-

Eastbound traffic on Wollombi Road will be detoured via Cumberland Street and Hall Street.

Westbound traffic on Wollombi Road will be detoured via Darwin Street and Hall Street.

Northbound traffic on Vincent Street will be detoured via Cumberland Street or Darwin Street.

Heavy Vehicle Detours-

Northbound heavy vehicles will be directed to detour via Aberdare Rd, South St, Darwin St and Wollombi Rd.

Southbound heavy vehicles will be directed to detour via Wollombi Rd, Darwin St, South St and Aberdare Rd.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Perth Glory at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 3pm and full-time around 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.
